What's file report for encoding?
well the text file I've put this in says ISO-8859 text, but the original document says "exported SGML document text"
Okay, that'll be an NBSP then...  Hmm...
Okay, give this a try.  Open the file in vi(m).  Type :%s/^kns/ /g  (^k = control+k, it and the ns should form a nonbreaking space, which will probably look wierd).  Then :wq to save and quit.
sed is able to find and replace characters per the hexcode.  So who cares what the silly character is, I've killed it with a sed 's_\xA0__'
